com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class SearchLookupValuesRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.SearchLookupValuesRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class SearchLookupValuesRequest
extends SiperianRequest
    This request is used to search for lookup values that match a given lookup display name (lookup code description).

    Lookup values can only be retrieved for foreign key columns that have existing constraints. For detailed information on configuring relationships and lookups in the Siperian Hub, see the chapter "Building the Schema" in the Siperian Hub Administrators Guide. The DescribeSiperianObjectRequest can be used to get base object metadata, which provides information regarding columns that have lookups and the corresponding column identifiers.

    This API allows search criteria to be specified on the lookup display name compared to GetLookupValuesRequest which retrieves all lookup values for a lookup column.

    Required Parameters:

    • setLookupField(LookupField) - A LookupField object which includes an identifier for the column and the lookup display name to search for.
    • setComparisonOperator(ComparisonOperator)- A ComparisonOperator that applies to the lookup display name specified in the LookupField object.
    • setValuesToReturn(int) - Number of lookup values to return. This value will be ignored if it exceeds the system limit for the maximum number of records returned. This limit (GETLIST Limit) can be changed for an ORS using the Databases tool. For more information, see the chapter "Configuring Operational Record Stores and Datasources" in the Siperian Hub Administrator Guide.

    Usage Example:

    The following example searches for lookup display names that start with the letters "SIP" in the CATEGORY_CODE_ROWID column of the C_SUB_CATEGORY base object:

    //You can retrieve a column identifier that has a lookup defined using
    //DescribeSiperianObjectRequest on either a package or base object
    //and use this as input to get the lookup display names for the column

    SearchLookupValuesRequest request = new
    SearchLookupValuesRequest();

    //Set the lookup field
    //This example will search for lookup display names that start with
    //"SIP"
    LookupField lookupField = new LookupField();
    lookupField.setUid("COLUMN.C_SUB_CATEGORY|CATEGORY_CODE_ROWID");
    lookupField.setValue("SIP");
    request.setLookupField(lookupField);
    request.setComparisonOperator(ComparisonOperator.LIKE_STARTS_WITH);
    request.setValuesToReturn(5);
    request.setReturnTotal(true);

    //Process the request
    SearchLookupValuesResponse response = (SearchLookupValuesResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    See Also:
    SearchLookupValuesResponse, ComparisonOperator, GetLookupValuesRequest, GetLookupValuesResponse, GetLookupValueRequest, GetLookupValueResponse, DescribeSiperianObjectRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: SearchLookupValuesResponse

    API Group: Data Steward

      • setDisablePaging

        public void setDisablePaging(boolean disablePaging)
        A search token (required for paging) will not be returned if paging is disabled. Paging is enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        disablePaging - True = Disable paging.
        See Also:
        GetSearchResultsRequest

      • setComparisonOperator

        public void setComparisonOperator(ComparisonOperator comparisonOperator)
        Sets the comparison operator used in the search operation. This applies to the lookup display name specified in the LookupField object of the request.
        Parameters:
        comparisonOperator - Operator to use in the search operation.

        See corresponding setter method for details.

      • setReturnTotal

        public void setReturnTotal(boolean returnTotal)
        Sets whether to return the total count of the search results. Setting this parameter to false can improve performance when there are many results.
        Parameters:
        returnTotal - True = Return count of all matching values.

      • setValuesToReturn

        public void setValuesToReturn(int valuesToReturn)
        Set the number of values to return. This value will be ignored if it exceeds the system limit for the maximum number of records returned. This limit (GETLIST Limit) can be changed for an ORS using the Databases tool. For more information, see Chapter "Configuring Operational Record Stores and Datasources" in the Siperian Hub Administrator Guide.

        Parameters:
        valuesToReturn - Number of values to return.

      • getTransactionAttributeType

        public TransactionAttributeType getTransactionAttributeType()
        Each concrete request class will have a transaction type that it uses.

        This only matters when EjbSiperianClient is used, where your application code can process multiple requests in one transaction (and use rollback, and so on) by running within an EJB context or by creating a UserTransaction.

        If the subclass does not override this method, the default here is TransactionAttributeType.SUPPORTS

        Overrides:
        getTransactionAttributeType in class SiperianRequest
        Returns:
        Never null, and constant for each request subclass.
